programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A large quantity of drugs is discovered when an uninsured motorist is pulled over, and a helicopter is used to track down a pair of burglars. A driver suspected of road rage is stopped and found to be armed with a table leg, and an officer's search for taxi-fare dodgers causes disruption

programme.title: Siege at Red River (1954)
programme.desc: Confederate agent James Farraday steals a Gatling gun prototype from the Yankees. But smuggling it south through enemy territory proves more difficult, especially with detective Frank Kelso on his back, treacherous scout Brett Manning double-crossing him, and nurse Nora Curtis to protect. Western, starring Van Johnson, Jeff Morrow and Joanne Dru

programme.title: The Four Musketeers (1974)
programme.desc: The swashbuckling heroes, with young swordsman D'Artagnan promoted to their ranks, are sent to quell an uprising against the king. But the scheming Cardinal Richelieu continues plotting to seize power, while his treacherous partner-in-crime Milady de Winter has revenge in mind. Adventure sequel, starring Oliver Reed, Michael York, Charlton Heston, Faye Dunaway, Christopher Lee, Richard Chamberlain and Frank Finlay

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A helicopter is used in the pursuit of an armed robber, ending in a serious accident. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
In one of the fastest pursuits in interceptor history, units mobilise to try to stop a 185mph superbike that is pulling wheelies, giving stinger teams the run-around, and even testing the flying skills of the National Police Air Support Unit. With the lives of other motorists at risk, the last resort is authority for tactical contact between cop car and the motorbike, but can advanced driver Paul Charlesworth pull it off?
S22E02

programme.title: Lock Up (1989)
programme.desc: A convict is transferred to a maximum security prison, where he falls foul of a sadistic warden with a grudge against him - and who abuses his position of power to make the inmate's life a misery and destroy his good relationship with the guards. Thriller, starring Sylvester Stallone, Donald Sutherland, Darlanne Fluegel and Tom Sizemore

programme.desc:
The team closes in on a suspected petrol thief, stops a motorist with a stash of suspicious goods in his boot, and tracks a motorist who heads to the fair after ditching his car. The police also have an appointment with a drink-driver who crashed into a doctor's surgery, and the owner of an uninsured car tests the officers' patience to the limit

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A driver mounts pavements, bumps into cars and collides with an ambulance as he tries to escape officers during a chase through the streets of Ripley in Derbyshire. An out-of-control car crashes into an interceptor's vehicle, and a helicopter is called in when a driver tries to lose his pursuers by taking the chase off-road
S04E11

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PCs Matt Turner and Rich Woodward are on the tail of an uninsured vehicle. When they finally catch up to the vehicle and question the suspect, they're surprised to discover the driver has never taken a driving test. On the M6, Inspector Anton Sullivan is responding to a collision between a car and an HGV. As the HGV has stopped on a live lane, Anton is tasked with trying to stop traffic, across six busy lanes, while in an unmarked police vehicle
S03E03

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
On the A1, officers battle to stop a dangerous driver from careering down the carriageway in 18 tons of stolen lorry. After a successful strike with a heavy-duty stinger, the driver carries on until he runs out of road and takes his chances on foot. but he crosses the path of two security dogs on duty with their handler. Meanwhile, in Sutton-in-Ashfield, firearms cops Richard and Ash are forced to use the big red key when a wanted man refuses to open the door, and over in Hucknall, the results of a roadworthy check don't go down too well.
S22E03

programme.title: Banged Up: HMP Frankland
programme.desc: Documentary exploring life inside HMP Frankland, the men's maximum security prison in County Durham, which has housed some of the country's most notorious criminals, including Peter Sutcliffe, Ian Huntley and Delroy Grant. The programme recounts some of the violent prison attacks that have taken place over the years, including one so horrifying that it forced a staff member to retire. Later, an ex-prisoner shares how he passed the time in Frankland's segregation unit by organising a quiz through the cell windows

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Documentary following the work of high-speed interception teams, this time with access to the officers of Cumbria's Roads Policing Unit. Glen has a busy night in Barrow-in-Furness dealing with a drunk and a runaway knifeman, and Colin detains a suspected drug dealer who has a wrap of heroin hidden in a very intimate place. Countryside and city collide when Duggie has to tackle a trailer full of cows that has overturned, blocking the main carriageway into Carlisle, while the alcohol-fuelled actions of one driver send officers rushing to evacuate villagers in the middle of the night after a crash ruptures a gas main
S05E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PCs Matt Turner and Rich Woodward are on the tail of an uninsured vehicle. When they finally catch up to the vehicle and question the suspect, they're surprised to discover the driver has never taken a driving test. On the M6, Inspector Anton Sullivan is responding to a collision between a car and an HGV. As the HGV has stopped on a live lane, Anton is tasked with trying to stop traffic, across six busy lanes, while in an unmarked police vehicle
S03E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A stick of dynamite causes chaos for Duggie when it is brought into Carlisle's main police station and the armed response unit is called out after there is a report of a gun being spotted in a city centre bar. Duncan receives a shock when a cyclist who has been trapped under a car turns out to be someone he knows, officers haul in a driver who is well over the limit and Hayley comes to the rescue when a teenager's car hits a wall during a late-night drive. Documentary following the work of Cumbria's Roads Policing Unit
S05E02

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:

S06E08

programme.title: Inside HMP Frankland: Evil Behind Bars
programme.desc: Documentary exploring life inside HMP Frankland, the men's maximum security prison in County Durham, which has housed some of the country's most notorious criminals, including Peter Sutcliffe, Ian Huntley and Delroy Grant. The programme recounts some of the violent prison attacks that have taken place over the years, including one so horrifying that it forced a staff member to retire. Later, an ex-prisoner shares how he passed the time in Frankland's segregation unit by organising a quiz through the cell windows

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the Magic Weekend fixtures at St James' Park in Newcastle, including Warrington Wolves v Hull FC and Wigan Warriors v Catalans Dragons

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 31/05/2023: Jon Kay and Nina Warhurst present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
Julia Somerville, Gloria Hunniford and Angela Rippon assess the performance of companies that offer multiple services in the name of ease and simplicity, as well as firms that could be doing a lot more to make life easier. Plus, legal expert Gary Rycroft helps out a man who is struggling to deal with his 'life admin' after a life-changing accident
S15E13

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: Episode 3 (45 Min): Michelle Ackerley reports on the dedicated fraud-fighters pursuing the criminals who steal £40billion a year from the public purse. This edition features a supposedly trustworthy local pharmacist 'doctoring' prescriptions to earn £76,000 and the corrupt council workers taking £1million of public money in a sophisticated inside job

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts finds a surprise hidden in a bungalow in Stafford and Dion Dublin heads to a semi-detached in Stoke-on-Trent. Plus, revisiting a former church in West Yorkshire, whose newlywed owners planned to transformed it into their dream forever home
S24E45

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Newark 13: Danny Sebastian and Colin Young are in Newark, Nottinghamshire, to help two teams look for items of value to take to auction. Presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp visits nearby Sherwood Forest to discover how the hideout of a famous outlaw has helped become a beacon for sustainability. Later, she and the contenders head to the auction in Derby
S60E01

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Father Figure: Zara is flattered by Miles' flirting and Rob addresses the elephant in the room. Al meets a teenage boy who is convinced his sister's symptoms are supernatural
S24E72

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc:
Sarah Moore visits Keynsham recycling centre in Somerset in search of items to be rescued. She brings Furniture painter Chloe Kempster a dressing table in need of attention whilst light designer Duncan McKean transforms four glass lampshades. Sarah works on bringing new life to a dead shrub
S14E08

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Buckinghamshire: Leafy Buckinghamshire is Sonali Shah's destination as she helps a London couple search for their dream countryside home. Sonali also visits the county's last independent brick-maker and learns how it is done, but soon discovers it is not as easy as it looks
S22E34

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc:
Hereford: Eleanor and Rob from Hereford ask the team to help them make an eco-friendly garden for themselves and their two daughters to enjoy using recycled materials and a budget of £4,500
S08E03

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
The team are in London to help a single mum of three reclaim her bedroom and get her young daughters back in their own beds
S02E03

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Ria Lina joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers
S29E28

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Angellica Bell present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay struggles to say goodbye to his wife and Phil is overwhelmed by his feelings. Kathy and Callum promise Lola they will look after Lexi for her. Linda hosts a lock in at The Vic to give some moral support and a place to reflect

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The aspiring chefs are put through their paces by celebrated chef Clare Smyth, who cut her teeth with pioneers Gordon Ramsay and Alain Ducasse, at her central London restaurant Core. They each cook one of her food creations at a special lunch for a select group of chefs including Sat Bains, Tom Kitchin, Jonny Lake and Nieves Barragán Mohacho. Can the amateurs hold their nerve or will the pressure prove too intense?
S19E23

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The sewers are tasked with making garments for a travel wardrobe, starting with a good sturdy rucksack. For the transformation they head to the seaside to sculpt windbreakers into emergency rainwear before creating some made-to-measure swimsuits
S09E02

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc:
Dannii Minogue makes a show-stopping entrance as the boys gather for a second kiss off, and a series of cold shoulders leave a number of boys left unkissed - leading to a very dramatic dinner party
S01E05

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc:
There's a chill in the air as the dinner party drama continues and an explosive argument leaves everyone in shock, but the love game gets back on track when Dannii introduces two new boys, just in time for the Kiss Off
S01E06

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc:
Brentford defender Ethan Pinnock, Olympic hockey champion Hollie Pearne-Webb, world indoor 60m title-winner Richard Kilty and European gold medal-winning diver Tonia Couch join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness
S52E24

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Nina Warhurst present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the home repair policies that have failed to live up to buyers' expectations, the car insurance that have caused headaches instead of peace of mind and the funeral plans that have fallen apart
S15E14

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: Episode 4 (30 Min): A sophisticated police surveillance operation to foil a criminal gang running an £8million fake ticket fraud against a vital transport network. Presented by Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Tommy Walsh and Dion Dublin assess two properties changing ownership in Lancashire and another in Somerset. They then meet the new owners, who outline their plans for their aquisitions
S26E28

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Southwell 2: Roo Irvine hosts the latest contest from Southwell, Nottinghamshire, and learns about the forgotten industry of tin box manufacturing. Experts Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall provide advice for the two competing teams
S62E31

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Cold Call: Bear is determined to fix things with Claudia, while Zara gets an unexpected message and Al decides to cheer Emma up with a deliciously brilliant plan. When Scarlett is accused of theft, she starts to suspect that a fake carer is taking advantage of her elderly VPAS patients and enlists Suni's help to uncover the truth. With Kim Hartman (Helga in 'Allo, 'Allo)
S24E73

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc:
JJ Chalmers is at Wallyford recycling centre on Scotland's east coast hoping to uncover three lucrative items amongst the skip-bound trash. He enlists the help of sign-writer Joel Poole to repurpose some rusty saws, while designer Nicky Cash tries to come up with a creative redesign for an unwanted dressing table and mirror. Meanwhile, JJ sets himself the challenge of transforming a broken-up wooden playhouse
S14E09

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
East Devon: Jonnie Irwin help a couple who have £650,000 budget to find a home in Devon, wanting to be close to the coast. Away from the search, he also visits Beer, a picturesque fishing village long associated with smugglers, where he tries not to disturb the residents of the local caves
S22E54

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc:
Groby: Riya and Nanda have a sad and unloved garden in Groby, Leicestershire, with an outdated pink and yellow 'Battenburg' patio, a tumble down shed and a huge gravel slope. This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam offer expert advice, which involves picking up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting
S08E04

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards head to north London to help grandmother Maura make over her messy lounge. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they build a birdwatching area for her grandchildren, fix the unsafe stairs and give the living room a new identity by creating a multi-purpose family space
S02E04

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Ria Lina joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers
S29E29

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 01/06/2023: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda is shocked when Elaine's fiancé, George Knight, and his daughters Anna and Gina arrive from Marbella with plans to help run The Vic. Jack and Phil recognise him as a championship boxer and Nish learns very quickly that he is not to be messed with. Bobby is immediately smitten with the Knight girls but things go wrong for them when they try to lift the mood at The Vic

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion
S19E24

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.desc:

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc:

Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.desc: Cage fighting pro Stevie 'Braveheart' Ray is just one fight away from becoming Scotland's first world champion. This documentary captures the all-or-nothing tale of the lead-up to a major prize fight - and the aftermath - as told through the eyes of his wife Natalie, a 30-year-old mother of four. The PFL world championship is staged in Madison Square Gardens, New York, and the top prize is a million dollars. However, MMA can be dangerous, with fighters having only a pair of 4oz gloves for protection. Both physical pain and mental health are factors to be considered

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:

The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s
S08E05

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa
S09E03

programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish
S01E03

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Clissold Park, Stoke Newington 2: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc:

With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc:

Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.desc:

At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:

Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: Cornwall (Extended Version): Steve Brown helps a couple from Hertfordshire to find a new home in their favourite holiday destination of Cornwall, as well as meeting a local ceramicist

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish
S01E03

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Clissold Park, Stoke Newington 2: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc:
Annie invites Terry to Marlene's party in the hope that it will help him to make a fresh start. With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

Meanwhile, JJ sets himself the challenge of transforming a broken-up wooden playhouse

This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam offer expert advice, which involves picking up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion
S19E24

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean

The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.desc:

Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish
S01E03
