programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Clissold Park, Stoke Newington 2: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms

With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. programme.desc:

Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s
S08E05

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa
S09E03

programme.title: Iorram - Boat Song
programme.desc: A cinema documentary entirely in Scottish Gaelic, Iorram (Boat Song) is a lyrical portrait of life in Scotland's Outer Hebrides, past and present. Director Alastair Cole takes the audience on an immersive journey into the heart and soul of a 1000-year-old community, blending archive sound recordings of voices from the past with visuals of island life today and an original score by acclaimed folk musician Aidan O'Rourke. At the core of the film is an extraordinary trove of sound archive, recorded by pioneering Scottish ethnographers in the mid-20th century, who visited the Western Isles to capture the hardship and romance of life lived in precarious balance with the sea. These newly restored recordings preserve an oral history of lore and legends, tall tales and tragedies, passed down through generations of Gaelic speakers. This soundtrack of voices, stories and songs from the past is accompanied by moving imagery of the daily working rhythm of the islands, on land and on water, shot ov

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the Magic Weekend fixtures at St James' Park in Newcastle, including Warrington Wolves v Hull FC and Wigan Warriors v Catalans Dragons

programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose heads for the North Pennines in the latest stage of his journey. He goes white-water rafting down the River Tees - and takes in one of Britain's best views at High Cup Nick. He also hears about a weather phenomenon unique to the Pennine Way and spends a night at a remote mountain refuge close to the highest point of the route
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Scottish Style: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam
S01E04

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc:
The Secrets of the South: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo
S01E01

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc:
Going Big: Part two of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the largest known cosmic structures, including, a vast cloud of solar plasma which surrounds and protects the solar system, the black hole at the centre of the Milky Way, which emits the lowest note ever heard in the cosmos, and the giant arc, a collection of galaxies which spans more than three per cent of the observable universe
S01E02

programme.title: The Long Roads
programme.desc: An elderly Scottish woman learns she is dying of cancer, so she and her cantankerous old husband set off to visit their children - now geographically and socially miles apart - and inform them of the news. One-off drama by John McGrath, and starring Edith MacArthur and Robert Urquhart. Originally broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Tails You Win: The Science of Chance
programme.desc: Professor David Spiegelhalter tries to get to grips with chance and how it works. He tackles such questions as whether people are wise to take an umbrella when they go out, to ways of maximising the chances of living to 100, as he tries to establish if luck and fate are embedded in the fabric of the universe. Along the way, he discovers hidden patterns and shapes in a book written exclusively with numbers and explains why going sky-diving only marginally increases his risk of dying sooner rather than later

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose heads for the North Pennines in the latest stage of his journey. He goes white-water rafting down the River Tees - and takes in one of Britain's best views at High Cup Nick. He also hears about a weather phenomenon unique to the Pennine Way and spends a night at a remote mountain refuge close to the highest point of the route
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Scottish Style: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam
S01E04

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc:
The Secrets of the South: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo
S01E01

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc:
Going Big: Part two of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the largest known cosmic structures, including, a vast cloud of solar plasma which surrounds and protects the solar system, the black hole at the centre of the Milky Way, which emits the lowest note ever heard in the cosmos, and the giant arc, a collection of galaxies which spans more than three per cent of the observable universe
S01E02

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose explores rural Northumberland as he embarks on the last stage of his journey along the Pennine Way. He makes a remarkable discovery at the Roman archaeological dig at Vindolanda, finds out what lies beyond the red flags while on exercise with the Grenadier Guards and discovers how night-time walkers can have an almost magical experience in an area acclaimed for the quality of its dark skies
S01E04

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Building the Canals: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britain's finest engineering
S01E05

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga explores the house's history from the 1880s to the First World War, a period that saw the property sliding down the social scale and turning from a family home to a multiple occupancy. He discovers how a resident responded to the death of his baby daughter by opening a milk bar for the temperance movement, only to get into legal trouble for watering down his product. David also discovers the story behind a mysterious occupant who lived in the house under a pseudonym and learns how the battle of Passchendaele changed the residents' lives forever
S03E03

programme.title: Casablanca (1942)
programme.desc: The American expat owner of a Moroccan nightclub is reunited with his old flame during the Second World War. Now married to a Czech freedom fighter, she needs his help to get them safely out of the country before they are captured by the Nazis - but the former lovers also have to wrestle the temptation to rekindle their simmering romance. Drama, with Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Claude Rains and Paul Henreid

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Ingrid Bergman in Her Own Words - Imagine: Director Stig Bjorkman's film profiles Oscar-winning Swedish actress Ingrid Bergman, who became one of the most celebrated stars of American and world cinema. With contributions from her daughters Isabella Rossellini and Pia Lindstrom, with Alicia Vikander reading from the Hollywood icon's letters and diaries

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc:
Part two of two. The team takes a helicopter to the crater of an active volcano in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has rarely been studied. The mountain is surrounded by forests, which provide cover for armed militant groups, and the scientists will only have a few short hours to gather information. They then move on to the surrounding area, a dangerous landscape marked by craters from past eruptions
S01E02

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose explores rural Northumberland as he embarks on the last stage of his journey along the Pennine Way. He makes a remarkable discovery at the Roman archaeological dig at Vindolanda, finds out what lies beyond the red flags while on exercise with the Grenadier Guards and discovers how night-time walkers can have an almost magical experience in an area acclaimed for the quality of its dark skies
S01E04

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Building the Canals: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britain's finest engineering
S01E05

He discovers how a resident responded to the death of his baby daughter by opening a milk bar for the temperance movement, only to get into legal trouble for watering down his product. David also discovers the story behind a mysterious occupant who lived in the house under a pseudonym and learns how the battle of Passchendaele changed the residents' lives forever

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jarvis Cocker introduces performances and videos from October 20, 1994, a show featuring Michelle Gayle, Let Loose, Oasis, Ultimate Kaos, INXS, Elastica, Tom Jones and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces music from late October 1994, featuring Snap, China Black, Pink Floyd, Rozalla, Sting, Bon Jovi, Green Day, East 17 and Pato Banton

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 05/06/1986: Simon Bates and Gary Davies introduce performances by Cashflow, Simply Red, Pet Shop Boys, Doctor and the Medics, Genesis, Nu Shooz and Jaki Graham. From 5 June 1986

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 02/06/1977: Noel Edmonds looks at the weekly pop chart from June 2 1977 and introduces Elkie Brooks, the Muppets, Twiggy, Jesse Green, Hot Chocolate, the Strawbs, Genesis, the Four Seasons, Heatwave, Carol Bayer Sager and Rod Stewart, with a dance sequence from Legs & Co

programme.title: In Concert: Gordon Lightfoot
programme.desc: A concert by the Canadian singer-songwriter, accompanied by Red Shea and Richard Haynes. The trio perform songs including Summer Side of Life, Saturday Clothes, That's What You Get for Loving Me, If I Could Read Your Mind and Steel Rail Blues

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc:
Sounds of the Sixties: The Folk Revival: Folk performances by artists including Pete Seeger, Tim Buckley, Joan Baez, Bob Dylan and Leonard Cohen
S01E04

programme.title: Once Were Brothers: Robbie Robertson and the Band (2019)
programme.desc: The story of how the Canadian guitarist overcame adversity and found camaraderie alongside the four other men who would become his brothers in music in the Band. The film blends rare archive footage, photography, songs and interviews with Robertson's friends and collaborators, including Martin Scorsese, Bruce Springsteen, Eric Clapton and Van Morrison

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools introduces a diverse mix of musical performances from the American folk, blues, bluegrass and country scenes. Featuring Robert Plant and Alison Krauss, Carolina Chocolate Drops, Odetta, Emmylou Harris, Norah Jones, Buddy Guy and Johnny Cash

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jarvis Cocker introduces performances and videos from October 20, 1994, a show featuring Michelle Gayle, Let Loose, Oasis, Ultimate Kaos, INXS, Elastica, Tom Jones and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces music from late October 1994, featuring Snap, China Black, Pink Floyd, Rozalla, Sting, Bon Jovi, Green Day, East 17 and Pato Banton

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.desc:
Sounds of the Sixties: The Folk Revival: Folk performances by artists including Pete Seeger, Tim Buckley, Joan Baez, Bob Dylan and Leonard Cohen
S01E04

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc:
The first of two programmes in which Monty travels to Japan in spring to explore different aspects of the nation's gardens. Amidst the cherry blossoms, he begins his journey by visiting the earliest surviving boating garden of the Heian period. He also looks at the rolling green moss of a Buddhist garden and learns the secrets of creating a Zen landscape before visiting an unconventional garden created by a modern design legend. The presenter also learns about the art of Japanese stonemasonry, the famous tea ceremonies and receives a lesson in the delicate art of traditional flower arranging
S01E01

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc:
Circumnavigation: Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him
S01E01

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Mystery Break: Chemotherapy takes its toll on Ester. Jorund tries to make up with Charlotte but suspects she may be hiding bigger secrets. Lars invites love interest Miko on a date. In Norwegian
S01E05

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Zero Point: Ester wonders whether she has the strength to continue with the harshness of her treatment. Arild is invited to Japan on a once-in-a-life time work trip. Jorund gets a nasty shock. In Norwegian
S01E06

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
The Hour of Truth: Ester gets to find out if the treatment she endured has worked. Jorund must decide if he intends to forgive Charlotte, and Finn reveals a big secret he has been carrying around for many years. In Norwegian
S01E07

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc:
The Real Bonnie and Clyde: Timewatch: Documentary about American outlaws Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow. With unprecedented access to gang members' memoirs, family archives and recently released police records, Timewatch searches for the true story of the couple and their mob. While Hollywood portrayed the pair as the most glamorous outlaws in American history, the reality of life on the run was one of violence, hardship and danger. Narrated by Michael Praed
S30E03

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Book Signing: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E07

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Birthday Boy: Bob and Thelma throw a surprise party to cheer up Terry - but the blindfolded guest of honour begins to insult old friends, unaware they are listening to his every word
S01E06

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc:
Circumnavigation: Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him
S01E01

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc:
The first of two programmes in which Monty travels to Japan in spring to explore different aspects of the nation's gardens. Amidst the cherry blossoms, he begins his journey by visiting the earliest surviving boating garden of the Heian period. He also looks at the rolling green moss of a Buddhist garden and learns the secrets of creating a Zen landscape before visiting an unconventional garden created by a modern design legend. The presenter also learns about the art of Japanese stonemasonry, the famous tea ceremonies and receives a lesson in the delicate art of traditional flower arranging
S01E01

programme.title: Holst and Vaughan Williams: Making Music English
programme.desc: Historian Amanda Vickery and broadcaster Tom Service unearth the fascinating story of the life-long friendship between composers Ralph Vaughan Williams and Gustav Holst, whose music gave birth to the 'English sound' in the first half of the 20th century. They retrace the walking trips the two composers took together across the country to discover how influences ranging from the Renaissance masters to the folk genre imbued their music with the 'Englishness' recognised today

programme.title: Inside Classical
programme.desc: The BBC Philharmonic, conducted by Mark Wigglesworth, perform Vaughan Williams' pastoral masterpiece The Lark Ascending, with the orchestra's leader Zoe Beyers on violin. The concert, from Manchester's Bridgewater Hall, also features Elgar's Symphony No 2 and Wagner's prelude to his last music-drama work, Parsifal

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: Clemency Burton-Hill explores the life of Antonio Stradivari, a 17th-century violin-maker who created over one thousand stringed instruments. Visiting the Stradivarius exhibition at the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, she examines four of the violins and is joined by 2002 Young Musician of the Year winner Jennifer Pike to test some of them out

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: A record-breaking tennis player on the court and a boundary-busting social activist off the court, Billie Jean King talks to Amol Rajan about her extraordinary life and career. She discusses her lifelong battle for equality and inclusion, and how she has balanced her activism with both a sports career and a tumultuous personal life

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary telling the little-known story of sports legend Arthur Ashe off the tennis court. Known to most on account of his stellar sports career - he became the first black man to win Wimbledon in 1975 - the film uncovers Ashe's work as a social activist, a role that embraced not only the civil rights movement in the US and African Americans but all oppressed peoples throughout the world

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Kate Prince: Imagine: Kate Prince is a remarkable British dance pioneer whose renowned ZooNation company has transformed the profile of hip-hop and street dance across the country. Alan Yentob meets the choreographer as she prepares for her project Message in a Bottle, a West End production set to the songs of Sting. The programme follows the highs and lows of birthing a complex new dance show from day one in the studio to opening night, while also exploring the wider impact of Prince's work and politics on a younger generation of upcoming dancers

programme.title: Inside Classical
programme.desc: The BBC Philharmonic, conducted by Mark Wigglesworth, perform Vaughan Williams' pastoral masterpiece The Lark Ascending, with the orchestra's leader Zoe Beyers on violin. The concert, from Manchester's Bridgewater Hall, also features Elgar's Symphony No 2 and Wagner's prelude to his last music-drama work, Parsifal

programme.title: Holst and Vaughan Williams: Making Music English
programme.desc: Historian Amanda Vickery and broadcaster Tom Service unearth the fascinating story of the life-long friendship between composers Ralph Vaughan Williams and Gustav Holst, whose music gave birth to the 'English sound' in the first half of the 20th century. They retrace the walking trips the two composers took together across the country to discover how influences ranging from the Renaissance masters to the folk genre imbued their music with the 'Englishness' recognised today

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose sets off to walk all 630 miles of the South West Coast Path. The explorer hopes to discover wildlife, wild traditions and wild adventure at every turn
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Victorian Splendour: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giles's Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin
S01E06

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Naples: Using 3D scanning technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott uncover the hidden history of three Italian cities, beginning with Naples, from its earliest Greek and Roman origins. The pair explore the impact of the volcano of Mount Vesuvius, and how it both nurtured the region and exacted a terrible price on the local population. Alexander and Michael also delve into a labyrinth of underground spaces constructed by ruling Bourbon kings in the 19th century, that helped to sustain the city
S01E01

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc:
Derby: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri investigate a painting by 18th-century artist Joseph Wright of Derby, housed at the Derby Museum. The piece suffered an industrial scale restoration in the 1970s, but can the team peel back layers of modern restoration on the mysterious landscape painting stuck in the Derby vaults to reveal another hidden masterpiece?
S02E02

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc:
In at the Deep End: HMS Queen Elizabeth goes on dangerous sea trials for the first time in the North Sea, where every part of the vessel is put to the test and the first aircraft lands on the deck. After a few days at sea, the first problems start to emerge, including an explosion, a dangerous fuel leak, and some strange noises. Meanwhile, a crew member reveals how the Navy helped him make a fresh start from a life of crime, and the ship's Muslim chef works out how to cook pork without offending his religion
S01E02

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc:
In Search of the Wreckers: Timewatch: Looters made the most of an opportunity when the MSC Napoli ran aground in January 2007, spilling its cargo on Branscombe beach in Devon. However, they were reviving a tradition that stretches back centuries - connecting coastal communities around Britain to a sinister profession. Author Bella Bathurst embarks on an epic journey from the Isles of Scilly to the Orkney Islands to explore wrecking
S28E03

programme.title: Men at the Barre: Inside the Royal Ballet
programme.desc: Award-winning filmmaker Richard Macer is invited to film with a golden generation of talented young male dancers at the Royal Ballet to find out what it takes to be an elite dancer. Throughout the film, Richard learns that in the past, the man's role was just to lift the ballerina into the air, but now, the top male dancers have fanbases that even rival the best ballerina's. He also explores changes in choreography, which is starting to reflect masculinity in different ways, mirroring the changing perception of what it is to be man outside in the wider world

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose sets off to walk all 630 miles of the South West Coast Path. The explorer hopes to discover wildlife, wild traditions and wild adventure at every turn
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Victorian Splendour: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giles's Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin
S01E06

programme.desc:

The pair explore the impact of the volcano of Mount Vesuvius, and how it both nurtured the region and exacted a terrible price on the local population. Alexander and Michael also delve into a labyrinth of underground spaces constructed by ruling Bourbon kings in the 19th century, that helped to sustain the city

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc:

The piece suffered an industrial scale restoration in the 1970s, but can the team peel back layers of modern restoration on the mysterious landscape painting stuck in the Derby vaults to reveal another hidden masterpiece?
S02E02

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Traversing the rugged and mysterious north Cornish coast, explorer Paul Rose's first stop is Morwenstow, where he squeezes into the Trust's smallest property, the Hawker's Hut. Built in the 1800s by opium-smoking poet Reverend Hawker, it is popular with walkers who add their own graffiti. Next, Paul enjoys a tour of the wild and majestic Tintagel Castle, before heading to Padstow where the Mayday 'Obby 'Oss celebrations are in full swing. Paul is then put through his paces by a group of youngsters training to be surf lifesavers at Newquay's Fistral Beach
S01E02

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc:
Wind, Water and Steam: The former steeplejack sets out on an enthusiastic tour of Britain's industrial heritage, exploring the early use of wind and water power and visiting some steam engines still in use today. On his travels Fred meets a man who has built a windmill in his back garden and hunts for examples of early beam engines that are still functioning today
S01E01

programme.title: The Best of Les Dawson
programme.desc:
Tribute to the comedian featuring clips of some of his best sketches and stand-up routines. First shown in May 1997
S01E03

programme.title: Talking Comedy
programme.desc:
Les Dawson: Talking Comedy: Angela Thorne narrates a look back at clips of the comedian and writer's appearances on some of the BBC's best-loved talk shows
S01E03

programme.title: The Many Faces of
programme.desc:
The Many Faces of Les Dawson: Profile of the Manchester-born comedian known for his deadpan humour and jokes at the expense of his wife and mother-in-law. The programme explores his beginnings in northern clubs and appearance on talent show Opportunity Knocks, and charts his rise to stardom. Contributors include John Cleese, Robert Webb and Russell Kane. Narrated by Sally Phillips
S01E01

programme.title: Brian Cox's Jute Journey
programme.desc: The Succession actor travels to Calcutta, retracing the journey of jute workers who started out in his home city of Dundee and went on to seek their fortunes in India. On the way he meets Lily Thompson, who went deaf while working in the mills, and spent years using a special sign-language to communicate with the other workers. He also meets members of the Calcutta and Moffusil Society and samples deep-fried jute

programme.title: Neutrino: Hunting the Ghost Particle
programme.desc: The astonishing tale of how scientists have battled against the odds to detect and decode the neutrino - the strangest, most elusive particle in the universe

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
What Happens in Helmand: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Toy Soldier: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Truffle Hog: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn
S01E03

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Traversing the rugged and mysterious north Cornish coast, explorer Paul Rose's first stop is Morwenstow, where he squeezes into the Trust's smallest property, the Hawker's Hut. Built in the 1800s by opium-smoking poet Reverend Hawker, it is popular with walkers who add their own graffiti. Next, Paul enjoys a tour of the wild and majestic Tintagel Castle, before heading to Padstow where the Mayday 'Obby 'Oss celebrations are in full swing. Paul is then put through his paces by a group of youngsters training to be surf lifesavers at Newquay's Fistral Beach

On his travels Fred meets a man who has built a windmill in his back garden and hunts for examples of early beam engines that are still functioning today
S01E01

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose explores the spectacular coastline of southern Cornwall, discovering one of the world's finest stages at the Minack open-air theatre in Porthcurno. He also tries out the high-octane sport of coasteering on the Lizard Peninsula, joins a National Trust ranger for some clifftop wildlife spotting, and fires the Tudor cannons of Pendennis Castle in Falmouth
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc:
Mills and Factories: An exploration of the textile mills and factories that once thrived in Britain during the Industrial Revolution. From New Lanark in Scotland to the mill town of Burnley, Fred meets ex-workers to discover what life was really like, and chats to a group that has dedicated 30 years to restoring mill engines
S01E02

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: The presenter tells the story of the 17th-century residence in Derbyshire - the pleasure palace of playboy Cavalier and ambitious courtier William Cavendish. Through a collection of artworks and items held within the castle, Lucy uncovers a colourful tale, capturing the tensions of England in the 1600s that would eventually lead the nation to civil war

programme.title: Lucy Worsley's Fireworks for a Tudor Queen
programme.desc: The historian teams up with materials scientist Zoe Laughlin in an ambitious attempt to recreate one of the earliest and most spectacular firework displays in Britain. The extravagant festivities were originally laid on by Robert Dudley, a close friend of Queen Elizabeth I, as an attempt win the Virgin Queen's hand in marriage in 1575, and Lucy travels to Italy for clues on how to make the Tudor equivalent of a Catherine Wheel

programme.title: Kisses at Fifty
programme.desc: Bill Maynard stars in Colin Welland's 1973 play about a married factory worker who kisses a barmaid in front of the whole pub on his 50th birthday - and the consequences for all around him. Directed by Michael Apted and co-starring Rosemarie Dunham, Marjorie Yates and Lori Wells

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Blind Spots: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised
S01E04

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
A Pilgrim of Justice: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger
S01E05

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Correction: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama
S01E06

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose explores the spectacular coastline of southern Cornwall, discovering one of the world's finest stages at the Minack open-air theatre in Porthcurno. He also tries out the high-octane sport of coasteering on the Lizard Peninsula, joins a National Trust ranger for some clifftop wildlife spotting, and fires the Tudor cannons of Pendennis Castle in Falmouth
S01E03

From New Lanark in Scotland to the mill town of Burnley, Fred meets ex-workers to discover what life was really like, and chats to a group that has dedicated 30 years to restoring mill engines
S01E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stoke-on-Trent: Recruitment manager Rob McNamara presents the third dinner party in Stoke-on-Trent. Despite rarely cooking and never having played host before, he is confident he has a chance of winning the £1,000 cash prize

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Sheffield: Car salesman Paul and his partner Sara host first in Sheffield, but their evening is dogged by bickering. Next, glamorous newlyweds Russell and Shane plan an evening of romance, but their loved-up theme falls on deaf ears and their American menu raises a few eyebrows. Finally, kooky Janine and Neil's evening is full of revelations, but Russell and Shane are convinced they have it in the bag
S02E21

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Kissimmee: Sara Damergi searches the Kissimmee area of Florida to find a holiday home suitable for mother and daughter Jane and Bethan Thomas, who wish to buy a place close by the sunshine state's theme parks that they adore so much. Within their £70,000 budget, the options include a two-bedroom apartment and a three-bedroom lakeside house that offers a promising rental return

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: North Tenerife: Laura Hamilton comes to the aid of Yorkshire couple Michael and Ella Robinson, who are searching for a large property for holidays with members of their extended family in the north of Tenerife, working with a budget of £360,000

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc:
Dave and Lynn start work on their dream farmhouse kitchen-diner and Pete is shopping for a tractor for his family's new smallholding
S01E02

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc:
Kirkstall, Leeds: Plumber Veronica and joiner Stevie get together for the first time to turn a tired auction property in West Yorkshire into a spanking new family home
S02E03

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Norfolk to meet author and broadcaster Bob Flowerdew, where Henry eyes up a pinball machine from a damp shed
S07E27

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 1/5: This competition takes place in and around Liverpool, where the first to host is 41-year-old taxi business owner Rob, who plans a Scouse themed evening. The guests he is hoping to impress are 23-year-old fitness fanatic Toria, 44-year-old property developer Christine, 40-year-old South African business woman Sam, and 20-year-old student Inzy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 2/5: It is night two in Liverpool, and the turn of businesswoman Sam to try and impress with her South-African-themed evening, though her food is a bit hit and miss

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 3/5: Gym worker Toria hosts the third party in Liverpool, and hopes a kissing game around the dinner table, along with her flaky flapjacks, will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 4/5: Undergraduate Inzy is the fourth host in Liverpool, and he is on a mission to prove students really can cook. The flirting between him and Toria continues, but will he allow love to stand in way of the competition?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 5/5: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Tenerife: Ben Hillman helps Del and his wife Diane find the perfect holiday home on Tenerife, where they can spend their winter months in the sun with their grown-up children and baby grandson. The couple particularly love the west coast of the island, where they have their sights set on a family-sized property with a pool for their £120,000 budget. Ben finds five options for the couple to consider

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2020: Costa Blanca: The return of the programme in which a property expert offers advice to British householders aiming to buy a home abroad. Jasmine Harman is on Spain's Costa Blanca to help Wendy and Lee find a traditional countryside property. The couple, their two children, their pet Doberman and their West African parrot are planning a permanent move to Spain and would like a four-bedroom detached house with plenty of outside space, all for their budget of £150,000. Can Jasmine find their perfect place?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
In an edition of the documentary focusing on fathers and sons, 51-year-old builder Rod is rushed into A&E after falling 18 feet from scaffolding onto concrete. When scans reveal that he has fractured some of his vertebrae and will require extensive surgery, his wife Nicky is left to call their two sons to prepare them for bad news. Meanwhile, 86-year-old retired policeman John is brought to St George's with a head injury after falling off a wall. As doctors assess the severity of the damage, he talks about how his career took over his life, so much so that he missed the birth of his son. Plus, 19-year-old cyclist Mack requires specialist help for a dislocated shoulder, after he collided with a Porsche. His dad explains how adopting him and his brother changed all of their lives
S10E10

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
A night out with friends ends badly when a car crashes into two vehicles, with police, firefighters and paramedics called to the scene. In Birmingham, a young woman is found lying collapsed and unconscious in the street and needs medical help. Paramedics also attend to the needs of an apparently homeless person having difficulty walking in the city centre. Plus, a family night playing board games ends with a man lying unconscious on the kitchen floor
S06E10

programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc:
With more than one million households on England's social housing waiting list, according to Shelter England's social housing deficit campaign, filmmaker Ed Stafford moves into some of the UK's most troubled housing estates for 60 days and nights, to look beyond the tabloid headlines and experience first-hand the daily hardships that locals face. In this opening episode, Ed is in Northumberland Park, north London, where he meets a mum with three sets of twins under 11 who live in a one-bed council flat which has recurring damp. He also meets a 45-year-old resident who started smoking crack at 17 and now lives alone in a housing association flat
S01E01

programme.title: A Paedophile in My Family: Surviving Dad
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Galaxy Quest (1999)
programme.desc: The cast of a cancelled sci-fi series are reduced to a life of conventions and public appearances, only to find themselves genuinely transported into space. Naive aliens have mistaken the show for real life and want the actors to help defend them from an evil extraterrestrial warlord. Sci-fi comedy, starring Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman and Sam Rockwell

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Holidays
programme.desc:
A VIP invitation to explore some of the most amazing holiday facilities, including the Royal Mansour in Marrakesh and its ornate £40,000 Grand Riad. Plus, the Italian spa retreat of Palazzo Fiuggi, where its Life Rewind package costs £40,000 a week. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi.
S01E02

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Holidays
programme.desc:
A visit to the billionaires Bahamian retreat of Harbour Island and the pared-back luxury of £50,000-a-week King's View. Plus, the £18,000-a-night royal suite at the ultra-luxurious Burgenstock Hotel and Alpine Spa on Lake Lucerne, Switzerland, and the £8,500-a-night hotel Le Grand Controle on the grounds of the Palace of Versailles. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi
S01E03

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
Mode Lytham Hotel: The third visit of the week comes from the Mode Lytham Hotel in Lytham, Lancashire, where husband-and-wife team Andrew and Qidi Whitaker hope their hotel will bag them best in show
S2020E48

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stoke-on-Trent: Beauty parlour owner Michelle Minter delivers a gourmet menu at the penultimate dinner party in Stoke-on-Trent, featuring crostini with pork fillet and mushroom pate, and a twice-baked souffle. The atmosphere is tense after last night's argument, so everyone is relieved when Tracey gets stuck in traffic and they have to start without her

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Cornwall: Artistic couple Zaya and Damian kick off the competition in Cornwall with an aspirational modern British menu. Next, property developers Kelly and Jon cook a simple menu in the brand new kitchen of their newly-refurbished massive Georgian mansion, which wows their guests. And Emma and Gavin host a Cornish evening of food and fun. However, it remains to be seen who will walk away with the £1,000 cash prize
S02E29

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Tobago: Jonnie Irwin helps newlyweds Iris and Alan Ford from Kent, who with a budget of £300,000 are hoping to split their retirement between the UK and the island of Tobago in the Caribbean

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: Daytona, Florida: Jonnie Irwin helps Shelley and David Warner in their search for a property in Daytona, Florida, and shows them what they can get for their £230,000 budget. The Essex couple have high hopes as house prices in the sunshine state have fallen in recent times

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc:
Gary and Annette make plans to split their Somerset vicarage in two so they can rent out one half and live in the other
S01E03

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc:
Leicester: Carpenters Chris and Adam are paired up to take on the biggest renovation challenge ever seen on the programme as Tayo Oguntonade buys them a house in Leicester at auction that's been condemned, not once but twice. With just six months to renovate and sell it, with a tight budget to boot, will they roll up their sleeves and get stuck in or simply call in the bulldozers?
S02E04

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
The lads head to Birmingham, where they fall out over a bench that Henry thinks has value

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Complete strangers paramedic Sarah and garment technologist Paige team up to transform a crumbling house bought at auction into a dream home. The tired Victorian terrace in Stafford, the West Midlands, is packed with original features and, armed with a budget, a six-month schedule and advice from Simon O'Brien, they seem the perfect team. But with money leaking like water from a broken pipe, will there be enough left to make a profit?
S03E01

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole finds a miniature Hay Wain to lovingly restore as he and Simon O'Brien head to Suffolk and Constable Country
S07E07

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex/Suffolk 1/5: This competition takes place in Essex and Suffolk, where the first host, 29-year-old entrepreneur Chris, plans to treat his guests - Samantha, Joanna, Mark and Claire - to a night of fine French cuisine, with the added bonus of ripped abs on display

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex/Suffolk 2/5: It is the second night from Essex/Suffolk, and it is the turn of salon owner Sam to cook. She has opted for a good looking, simple menu, but foodie Chris is not impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex/Suffolk 3/5: Claire hosts the third night of the contest in Essex, and lays on a lavish East End-themed feast, but Sam may be looking for vengeance after everyone claimed her food was boring

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Essex/Suffolk 4/5: Day four in Essex sees Polish party girl Joanna offer a taste of her homeland in a bid to win the prize. But some of the unusual flavour combinations throw her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 5/5: The final dinner party in Suffolk is hosted by anti-social behaviour officer Rachel, who hopes to win over her guests with an evening of comfort food and a few tricks up her sleeve. She hates to lose, but will need to curb her comments towards the other guests and let her dishes do the talking if she wants to be in with a chance of beating joint leaders Holly and Jonalt

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Costa del Sol: Kim is looking for a holiday home on Spain's eastern Costa del Sol and she's brought her younger sister Debbie along to help. Both Kim and Debbie grew up by the sea in south Wales, so they desperately want their holiday home to be within a stone's throw of a beach. Leah Charles-King shows them what their £115,000 can get as she lines up five properties for them to visit

programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts
programme.desc:
Alexandria: The historian takes a train journey across the world's oldest and greatest civilisation, starting at the very end of the Ancient Egyptian empire in Alexandria, before heading south to Cairo, Luxor and Aswan. Alice goes deep underground in search of Cleopatra, discovers how the Romans and the Greeks reacted to the treasures of Ancient Egypt and, on a visit to the site of the Lighthouse of Alexandria, she learns how a slave became a sultan and built his own fairy-tale caste
S01E01

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
Liam, 31, is rushed to St George's after collapsing at home after his fourth epileptic seizure of the day, and he experiences another at the hospital, while 89-year-old Mair is brought to A&E with severe chest pain and difficulty breathing and doctors take blood samples to test whether her symptoms are due to pneumonia. Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again
S11E04

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc:
The Aberdeen trauma team are dispatched by air to 52-year-old Mark, who is trapped after crashing and rolling his van into farmland. In Inverclyde, nine-year-old David has been thrown 50 yards off his quad bike and impaled onto a metal fence, while 59-year-old Jacqui is rushed to the Queen Elizabeth Major Trauma Centre with multiple injuries after her car fell 10 feet down an embankment
S02E04

programme.title: A Paedophile in My Family: Surviving Dad
programme.desc: Documentary following a successful businesswoman who carries the weight of a childhood of repeated sexual abuse by her father. With his release from prison, Emily considers confronting the person who dominated her childhood as she seeks to find out if the time inside has changed him at all. She reaches out to those from her formative years - teachers, family friends, and her mother, trying to understand how her abuse remained and reconnects with the police officers who dealt with her case, hidden for so long

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
Paramedics treat a woman who feels like she's going to pass out at work. As the paramedics arrive, they find her lying on the floor. A man needs morphine to combat the agony of kidney stones. A patient suffering with a painful hernia needs an operation, but due to the Covid-19 pandemic it's been postponed and now he's being constantly sick and can hardly move
S06E04

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
Edgecliff Boutique B&B: Marilyn and Neil Tuson host the second night of the week at Edgecliff Boutique B&B in Birchington-on-Sea, Kent - hoping the breathtaking views will give them the edge they need. Guests Emily and Warren are big fans of their room's sea views, but Bis and Deep find a dirty kettle and Ann and Rebecca aren't happy about a dusty chandelier. Later, in the morning, there's a long wait at breakfast
S2020E52

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:

The first hosts are construction manager Sati and his wife of 26 years, Jesse. They are followed by Nick and Dinara, with the finale left to Harry and Charlotte
S2019E07

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Naples, Florida: Each year Mary Anderson likes to avoid the UK's cold winter months by spending her time in Naples in Florida, and now wishes to secure her own property in the region. Sara Damergi helps her identify suitable premises, which include a house with its own pool and a beach apartment

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: Tampa, Florida: Jonnie Irwin helps Chris James and Susan Spencer from Norfolk find their dream waterfront holiday home in Tampa, Florida. The couple have a budget of £150,000, and are hoping to find a place their entire family will enjoy

programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bristol 1/5: The first dinner party in Bristol is hosted by theatre-lover Richard Hope-Hawkins, whose eclectic menu divides the guests even before they arrive. Teacher Laura Ford is impressed by the sound of home-made pate, and food writer Darryl Bullock is intrigued by the Rod Steiger gunge cake. However, vegetarian Zoe Kellaway is not looking forward to her alternative starter of red and green pepper mousse, while stonemason Andy Wright thinks the dishes have a feminine touch

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bristol 2/5: Primary school teacher Laura Ford hosts the second dinner in Bristol, and prides herself on throwing a highly organised party, meticulously planning every detail of the event. Her menu features a starter of prawn, chorizo and butternut squash salad, followed by a Balinese curry, and a trio of desserts

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bristol 3/5: The third dinner party in Bristol is hosted by food critic Darryl Bullock. A self-confessed animal lover, he hopes his pork belly roast will impress, but does not count on his pets leaving an unpleasant surprise for two of the guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bristol 4/5: Botox fan Zoe Kellaway hosts a 'pretty in pink' dinner party for the penultimate evening in Bristol. She hopes to cheer up the group by cooking a predominantly pink menu, which features beetroot risotto, and enlists the help of a butler in hot pants to serve cocktails

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bristol 5/5: Stonemason Andy Wright hosts the final dinner party in Bristol, confident the black-tie theme and his impressive Victorian flat will win him the £1,000 prize. He delivers an evening of champagne, caviar and canapes, but things take a turn for the worse when he burns the nut roast and loses a key ingredient for the dessert

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Costa de la Luz, Spain: Retired teachers Carrie and Steve are looking for their dream property in the town of Islantilla on Spain's Costa de la Luz. With a budget of £110,000, they're after a two-bedroom apartment as close to the beach as possible, where they hope to while away the winters. Leah Charles-King lines up five properties for the pair to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2020: Sucina, Spain: Scarlette Douglas tries to find the perfect place for Tony and Carol, who have been married for 40 years and are looking for their dream holiday home in the Spanish town of Sucina

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the transformation of their sitting room. They have some elegant features planned, and for inspiration they visit Ford Abbey, a gothic grade 1 listed monastery, to soak up what grandeur looks like on a huge scale. But as well as building their dream house, they have 220 acres of farmland to think about and having tickled their tastebuds with cider last year, Graham buys four apple trees. It may not be an orchard, but it's a start

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
A night out with friends ends badly when a car crashes into two vehicles, with police, firefighters and paramedics called to the scene. In Birmingham, a young woman is found lying collapsed and unconscious in the street and needs medical help. Paramedics also attend to the needs of an apparently homeless person having difficulty walking in the city centre. Plus, a family night playing board games ends with a man lying unconscious on the kitchen floor
S06E10

programme.title: Bad Boys (1995)
programme.desc: Detectives Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett search for a $100million heroin consignment brazenly stolen by a French drug kingpin from the police evidence room. However, after a mix-up over a phone call from a potential witness, each cop has to assume the other's identity - Lowrey becoming the henpecked family man and Burnett the playboy. Michael Bay's action thriller, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Tea Leoni, Tcheky Karyo and Theresa Randle

programme.desc: Swansea 4/5: Triathlete Tula serves a Spanish-themed menu in Swansea, hoping charm and chorizo can smooth over the dispute between Ross and Julie and avoid a punch-up over the paella

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Cheeky Jack Russell Rocco seeks a new home after his loving owner's health took a turn for the worse, setting his sights on Charnelle and Holly and their seven-year-old son Reay. However, they have their minds set on a French bulldog. Later, fur flies as Karen and Stefano meet two of Woodgreen's biggest and hairiest residents - husky brother and sister Olli and Kalli. Jess is looking for unconditional love after a recent break-up and Staffordshire bull terrier Gloria might well be the ideal buddy she needs right now

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc:
Tom and Lori from London decide to leave the city and build a home at Graven Hill in Oxfordshire to give them a taste of the countryside and allow them to embark on an architectural adventure. programme.desc: Whistleblower Elena Houghlin has evidence that the Calisto energy conservation project can be hacked for nefarious means. Comedy thriller inspired by the TV series, starring Kristen Stewart, Ella Balinska, Naomi Scott and Elizabeth Banks, who also wrote and directed

programme.title: Women Who Kill
programme.desc:
With more than 30,000 women in prisons in America serving lengthy sentences for murder, this documentary looks at some of the extraordinary stories of women who committed these crimes, and the reasons why they killed people they knew and loved. They include Amber Hilberling, who was 19 and pregnant when she pushed her husband out of a window, Patricia Ignacio, who admitted to bludgeoning her cousin to death with a rock, and Ana Trujillo, who murdered her boyfriend by stabbing him with a stiletto shoe
S01E01

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
Seventy-year-old Jenny is brought in with a suspected stroke, and doctors must confirm the diagnosis and decide whether she is still in time to receive life-changing treatment. Her husband Roy shares the difficult experiences they've faced together and describes Jenny as the rock of the family. Ronnie has come into St George's with severe lower back pain. Doctors assess whether the 29-year-old's pain is due to his kidney stones or something more serious. Ronnie is accompanied by his girlfriend Anneline, who reflects on the similarities between Ronnie and her late father

programme.desc: The relationships of four couples living in Sydney become entangled after the discovery of an unidentified corpse.
